moves.1. Nf3 f6: I think this is called the Barnes Defense. I guess it is not terrible if your plan is to castle queenside.
moves.2. Nc3: Two Knights Tango. Usually creates classical positions.
moves.2... e5 3. e4 Nc6 4. Bc4 Bc5 5. d3 Nb4: Moving a piece twice at this stage is costly. Besides, it makes no threats and gives no benefit to the black's position.
moves.6. Qe2: Supporting my bishop when it comes e3.
moves.6... Nh6: This opens up an immediate attack. Ne7 would have been resoundingly better.
moves.7. Bxh6 gxh6 8. a3: I have to chase away the knight before I begin my attack.
moves.8... Nc6 9. Qd2 Rg8: Black wants an exchange, but instead just gives away a rook.
moves.11. Qxh6 a6: Black is pretending that they don't have a problem.
